1.brief: Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)

2.brief: Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to kneel; by implication to bless God (as an act of adoration), and (vice-versa) man (as a benefit); also (by euphemism) to curse (God or the king, as treason)
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character
properly, to be fresh, i.e. full (rosy, (figuratively) cheerful); to announce (glad news)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
something saved, i.e. (abstractly) deliverance; hence, aid, victory, prosperity

3.brief: properly, to score with a mark as a tally or record, i.e. (by implication) to inscribe, and also to enumerate; intensively, to recount, i.e. celebrate
a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts
properly, weight, but only figuratively in a good sense, splendor or copiousness
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
properly, perhaps to separate, i.e. distinguish (literally or figuratively); by implication, to be (causatively, make) great, difficult, wonderful

4.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
great (in any sense); hence, older; also insolent
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to be clear (orig. of sound, but usually of color); to shine; hence, to make ashow, to boast; and thus to be (clamorously) foolish; to rave; causatively, to celebrate; also to stultify
properly, vehemence, i.e. (with or without preposition) vehemently; by implication, wholly, speedily, etc. (often with other words as an intensive or superlative; especially when repeated)
to fear; morally, to revere; caus. to frighten

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative

properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)

good for nothing, by anal. vain or vanity; specifically an idol
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application

6.brief: grandeur (i.e. an imposing form and appearance)
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
strength in various applications (force, security, majesty, praise)
ornament (abstractly or concretely, literally or figuratively)
a consecrated thing or place, especially, a palace, sanctuary (whether of Jehovah or of idols) or asylum

7.brief: to give (whether literal or figurative); generally, to put; imperatively (reflexive) come
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
a family, i.e. circle of relatives; figuratively, a class (of persons), a species (of animals) or sort (of things); by extension a tribe or people
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
to give (whether literal or figurative); generally, to put; imperatively (reflexive) come

Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, weight, but only figuratively in a good sense, splendor or copiousness
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character
to lift, in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, absolute and relative
a donation; euphemistically, tribute; specifically a sacrificial offering (usually bloodless and voluntary)
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
a yard (as inclosed by a fence); also a hamlet (as similarly surrounded with walls)

9.brief: to depress, i.e. prostrate (especially reflexive, in homage to royalty or God)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
a sacred place or thing; rarely abstract, sanctity
properly, to twist or whirl (in a circular or spiral manner), i.e. (specifically) to dance, to writhe in pain (especially of parturition) or fear; figuratively, to wait, to pervert
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)

10.brief: a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to reign; inceptively, to ascend the throne; causatively, to induct into royalty; hence (by implication) to take counsel
meaning accession (used as an adverb or conjunction); also or yea; adversatively though

properly, to be erect (i.e. stand perpendicular); hence (causatively) to set up, in a great variety of applications, whether literal (establish, fix, prepare, apply), or figurative (appoint, render sure, proper or prosperous)
the earth (as moist and therefore inhabited); by extension, the globe; by implication, its inhabitants; specifically, a particular land, as Babylonia, Palestine
properly, a failure; by implication nothing; usually (adverb) not at all; also lest
to waver; by implication, to slip, shake, fall
a straight course, i.e. sail direct
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
evenness, i.e. (figuratively) prosperity or concord; also straightness, i.e. (figuratively) rectitude (only in plural with singular sense; often adverbially)

11.brief: probably to brighten up, i.e. (figuratively) be (causatively, make) blithe or gleesome
the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)
properly, to spin round (under the influence of any violent emotion), i.e. usually rejoice, or (as cringing) fear
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
to tumble, i.e. be violently agitated; specifically, to crash (of thunder); figuratively, to irritate (with anger)

a sea (as breaking in noisy surf) or large body of water; specifically (with the article), the Mediterranean Sea; sometimes a large river, or an artifical basin; locally, the west, or (rarely) the south

12.brief: to jump for joy, i.e. exult
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
at that time or place; also as a conjunction, therefore
properly, to creak (or emit a stridulous sound), i.e. to shout (usually for joy)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a tree (from its firmness); hence, wood (plural sticks)
a copse of bushes; hence, a forest; hence, honey in the comb (as hived in trees)
